yaml.title: Dr Luke Pembleton
yaml.description: Genomic Breeding Scientist and Global Strategic Science Manager at Barenbrug.

markdown.markdown:
[Education]{.highlight}

üéì Doctor of Philosophy, Molecular Genetics from La Trobe University, 2014 üéì Bachelor of Agricultural Science, Rural Technology from the University of Queensland, 2010

[About Me]{.highlight}

I am a Genomic Breeding Scientist and Strategic Science Manager at Barenbrug where I lead the development and implementation of commercial genomic breeding and associated 'omic' technologies.

[Interest and Skills]{.highlight}

My expertise lies predominantly in the realm of üß¨ **Genomics**, with a specialised focus on **Genomic Selection** and **Genomic Breeding**, particularly in the context of plants üå±. Proficient in **bioinformatics** üë®‚Äçüíª {{< fa brands linux >}}, I am driven by a deep passion for the {{< fa brands r-project >}} programming language. My skill set extends to crafting robust **cloud computing** ‚òÅÔ∏è {{< fa brands aws >}} environments tailored for both research and production pipelines. I take pleasure in orchestrating these systems with the precision of the **Nextflow** üîÇ workflow manager, and proudly serve as a **Nextflow Ambassador**. Through my technical endeavours, I am dedicated to advancing genomic research and breeding practices for a sustainable future.

[Experience]{.highlight}

![](images/Barenbrug.svg){width="36"} **Genomic Breeding Scientist \| Global Strategic Science Manager** Barenbrug \| August 2021 - Current \~ ![](images/AgVic.svg){width="40"} **Senior Research Scientist** Agriculture Victoria Research \| April 2017 - August 2021 \~ ![](images/AgVic.svg){width="40"} **Research Scientist** Agriculture Victoria Research \| October 2014 - March 2017 \~ ![](images/DPI.svg){width="40"} **Research Assistant** Victorian Department of Primary Industries \| June 2009 - December 2009
